intro: Potentilla sordida proles hedrichii, commonly known as the Hedrich's gloomy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. It has compound leaves with five leaflets and produces fruit that is a hairy capsule. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its genus.
